page.title: 10PEOPLE OF LITTLE BARFORD.
page.content: Then Mrs Morris told us about Nicholas Rowe.He was the poet Laureate for Queen Anne from 1715 until he died in 1718 he had been born in Little Barford and the cottage in which he had lived was taken down a few years ago and rebuilt in{Glatton}near{ {Peterborough.}It was bought by a Mr West who happened to be passing when the workman started to take it down.After talking to Mrs Morris we made our way to Mr Smith's cottage.There we met Mrs Smith and made arrangements to see Mr Smith at a later date.We then walked along a private road on the{Alington Estate} which took us under a railway bridge. After several minutes of walking and looking at the crops we turned round and went back to the car, and then back to school.
